text: [Music]
hi i'm dr. michael mosley and i'm the
author of the clever guts diet an awful
lot of people go to the gym in January
in order to lose weight I think if they
go to Gemini cycle a bit do a bit of
running then they will obviously shed
some of those kilos reality is it
doesn't happen which is why the vast
majority people give up so why doesn't
it happen well the simple reason is that
you have to do an awful lot of exercise
to burn off fat in order to lose a kilo
of fat you would probably have to run
two marathons so in many ways it is
looking much easier simply to reduce the
amount of calories you eat run trying to
run them off because you have to do so
much exercise to burn calories what I
would recommend is yes you do exercise
because that's going to improve your
mood and it's very helpful once you've
lost weight but hoping that simply by
doing exercise you're going to lose
weight is I think really over-optimistic
the other thing that happens and we know
this from studies is that when people do
exercise they often congratulate
themselves or compensate by eating more
so they go for a run and then they have
a muffin they probably burn 100 calories
going for the run and they put on 4 or
500 calories eating them up it the other
thing we know that happens when people
do exercise is they do pump it's a very
relaxing in other words they sit down
the rest of the day so you should be
aware of these tendencies as I said if
you really kind of want to lose weight
the only way to do that is by reducing
sort of calories you eat and switching
the sort of food you eat
[Music]
